item.title: Bitcoin Layer-2 Project BVM Gains Traction With Promise of 'Juicy' Airdrops
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa
item.description: The platform lets users start their own networks on Bitcoin and is offering developers millions of dollars as grant rewards.

item.title: Mike Novogratz’s Galaxy Digital Should be a ‘Core Holding’ for Digital Asset Investors, Stifel Says
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: There are a number of key catalysts for the company, and these include ETF net inflows, the development of GalaxyOne and a potential Nasdaq listing, the report said.

media:content.media:description: Mike Novogratz, founder and CEO, Galaxy Digital (Suzanne Cordiero/Shutterstock/CoinDesk)

item.title: Democrats Ask SEC's Gensler to Block Approval of More Crypto ETPs
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: Senators say that retail investors face "enormous risks" from such products because thin order books for some cryptocurrencies.
item.media:keywords: Jack Reed, Laphonza Butler, Paul Grewal, crypto ETP, crypto ETF, ether ETF, ether ETP

media:content.media:description: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)

item.title: Avalanche Foundation Snaps up KIMBO, COQ, and Three Other Tokens as First Meme Coin Investment
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa
item.description: The Foundation first said in December it would invest in meme coin as part of a digital culture drive.

item.title: Bitcoin's Correlation to Nvidia Strongest in Over a Year
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: The 90-day and 52-week correlation between bitcoin and Nasdaq-listed chip maker Nvidia is well above 0.80.

item.title: Bitcoin Tumbles to $67K As Asia Begins Trading Day
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: Bitcoin's price has begun a recovery, trading above $68,5K as the day continues.

item.title: El Salvador Has Thousands More Bitcoins Than Previously Known
item.dc:creator: Danny Nelson
item.description: The Central American nation moved $400 million in BTC into a cold storage wallet this week.

media:content.media:description: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele (Getty Images)

item.title: Ether ETFs Could Be Bigger Than Bitcoin ETFs, Says VanEck
item.dc:creator: Helene Braun
item.description: The issuer of the VanEck Bitcoin Trust this week dropped its management fee to zero for a limited time in an attempt to attract more capital to that fund.

media:content.media:description: Flows into VanEck's Bitcoin ETF are picking up (Shutterstock)

item.title: Craig Wright Was Finally Called Out in Court and Hodlonaut Is Celebrating
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn
item.description: “It hasn't always been easy, but I'm very happy that I stood my ground,” says Hodlonaut of his long legal fight with Craig Wright, who claimed, falsely, to be Satoshi Nakamoto.

media:content.media:description: Craig Wright sued Hodlonaut in Norway.(Trevor Jones for CoinDesk)

item.title: A $300M Ponzi Scheme That Targeted Latinos Falsely Claimed to Buy Crypto, SEC Says
item.dc:creator: Nikhilesh De
item.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission sued 17 individuals tied to an alleged Ponzi scheme that took in $300 million from over 40,000 victims.

media:content.media:description: SEC Enforcement Director Gurbir Grewal (right) (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)

item.title: Bitcoin Slumps 4%, Falling Below $70K; Solana Outperforms
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: Bitcoin could enter a period of consolidation before its next leg in the rally, observers noted.
item.media:keywords: bitcoin, bitcoin price, solana, solana price

item.title: Trump is Clear Favorite Among Crypto-Owning Voters in U.S. Presidential Race: Poll
item.dc:creator: Jesse Hamilton
item.description: U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump is the prevailing favorite of voters who own cryptocurrencies, according to a poll commissioned by crypto investment firm Paradigm and released on Thursday.

media:content.media:description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump is the clear favorite among voters who own crypto, according to a new poll. (Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)

item.title: Solana-Based Crypto Exchange Drift Plans Pre-Launch Market for New Tokens
item.dc:creator: Danny Nelson
item.description: Drift Protocol – a crypto spot and futures exchange that operates on the Solana blockchain – plans to expand into "pre-launch markets," too, with a service that lets traders bet on the price of tokens before they start officially trading.

item.title: Justice James Mellor's Ruling on Craig Wright, COPA Trial, in His Own Words
item.dc:creator: CoinDesk Staff

media:content.media:description: Craig Wright arrives at a London Court for the COPA trial. (Dan Kitwood/Getty Images)

item.title: The Biggest Bank Heist in History Is Coming
item.dc:creator: Linda Jeng
item.description: Regulators are permitting banks to tokenize financial assets such as bank deposits, U.S. Treasuries and corporate debt. But they want institutions to use permissioned networks rather than the decentralized blockchains that keep assets safe from hackers.

item.title: Story Protocol Works With Crypto-AI Firm Ritual To Train and Track Models On-Chain
item.dc:creator: Sam Kessler
item.description: Story Protocol will be used to "prove that outputs like text, image, and voice are generated by specific models" so that IP can be tracked, attributed, and compensated correctly.

item.title: Qatar’s Sovereign Fund Might Be Buying Bitcoin, But Surely Not $500B Worth
item.dc:creator: Lorna Blount
item.description: Government-led investments in crypto are increasingly plausible – but not at that rumored size.

item.title: Bitcoin Sells Off 3%; Is Macro Risk Returning to Market?
item.dc:creator: Stephen Alpher
item.description: U.S. economic data on Thursday has sent rates and the dollar higher.

item.title: Crypto Custody Firm Cordial Systems Names Jump Crypto as Client as It Exits Stealth
item.dc:creator: Ian Allison
item.description: Cordial Treasury gives all the software to the customer, not just a bit of a cryptographic key.

item.title: The Graph Expands Subgraph to More Than 40 Blockchains Including Arbitrum, Base

item.description: The indexing layer is also expanding to Avalanche and Celo.

item.title: North Korean Hackers Used Tornado Cash to Launder $12M From Heco Bridge Hack: Elliptic
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Notorious North Korean hackers Lazarus Group has returned to sanctioned coin mixing service Tornado Cash to launder $12 million worth of ether {{ETH}}.

item.title: Justin Sun Deposits $480M of ETH to Restaking Protocol Ether.Fi
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Tron founder Justin Sun deposited 120,000 ether worth $480 million into liquid restaking protocol Ether.Fi, according to blockchain data.

item.title: Crypto for Advisors: The Investment Case of Bitcoin vs. Ether
item.dc:creator: Sarah Morton, Alex Tapscott
item.description: With the dual tailwind of bitcoin ETF flows and the upcoming halving, is bitcoin the best bet? Not so fast. Ethereum, the next biggest crypto asset by market cap, has a case of its own to make.

item.title: Reddit Is Making a Deal With the AI Devil
item.dc:creator: Harry Halpin
item.description: The social media giant's $60 million real-time data deal with Google is latest example of internet companies selling out their users who have nominally "consented" to share their personal information but have no control. Blockchains and ZK-proofs could help prevent corporate overreach, Nym CEO and privacy advocate Harry Halpin writes.
item.media:keywords: aaron swartz, harry halpin, nym, decentralized social, reddit ai deal

media:content.media:description: Death and the Devil Surprising Two Women by Daniel Hopfer ca. 1515 (Metropolitan Museum of Art/Creative Commons)

item.title: Bitcoin Miner Bitdeer Is 'Differentiated' From Peers, Shares Are Cheap: Benchmark
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: Stock appears undervalued given the wide gap between the company’s valuation and its growth prospects, the report said.

item.title: Craig Wright Is Not Satoshi, Didn't Author Bitcoin Whitepaper, Judge Rules

item.title: U.S. Attorney’s Office Files Civil Forfeiture Action to Return $2.3M in Crypto Tied to 37 Scam Victims
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: The United States Attorney’s Office in Massachusetts filed a civil forfeiture action on Wednesday aimed at returning $2.3 million in cryptocurrency to 37 victims of online scams and fraud.

item.title: The Protocol: Is Ethereum's Dencun Update All It's Cracked Up To Be?
